author: ELIZABETH ELIZALDE
title: Budweiser’s Super Bowl ad shows founder’s immigrant journey
text:
Budweiser’s Super Bowl ad shows founder’s journey to find ‘American dream’ Budweiser’s Super Bowl ad shows founder’s journey to U.S. NEW YORK DAILY NEWS   5:21 PM 
This year’s Budweiser Super Bowl ad tells the story of a German immigrant – who co-founded the famous all-American beer brand – and his journey to the U.S. 
“We created the Budweiser commercial to highlight the ambition of our founder, Adolphus Busch, and his unrelenting pursuit of the American dream,” Marcel Marcondes, vice president of marketing at Anheuser-Busch, said in a statement to the Daily News. 
Marcondes added that the commercial highlights the company’s 141-year history and that the idea had been in the works for nearly a year. 
The unveiling of the new ad comes after President Trump signed an executive order prohibiting citizens of seven Muslim-majority countries from entering the U.S. But Budweiser insists the timing is merely a coincidence. 
Director Chris Sargent filmed the 60-second commercial, “Born the Hard Way,” in New Orleans. Budweiser’s 2017 Super Bowl commercial “Born The Hard Way” shows the story of a German immigrant coming to America. (Budweiser) 
The ad, which is set in the 1800s, depicts Busch’s journey to America while on a ship through several storms. After he had arrived, Busch faced discrimination because of his German heritage with people telling him, “You’re not wanted here” and “go back home.” 
Busch eventually settled in St. Louis, Mo., where he met his father-in-law Eberhard Anheuser – who also appeared in the commercial – and the two went on to create the company. 
Ricardo Marques, vice president of marketing at Budweiser, said the commercial “will resonate with today's entrepreneurial generation – those who continue strive for their dreams."
